verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
Daily daily sing to Mary,
sing my soul, her praises due.
All her feasts, her actions
worship, with the heart's
devotion true. Lost in wondering,
contemplation be her majesty
confessed: Call her mother,
call her virgin, happy mother,
virgin blest.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
She is mighty to deliver;
Call her, trust her lovingly.
When the tempest rages
round thee, she will calm the
troubled sea. Gifts of heaven
she has given, noble lady to
our race: She is the Queen
who decks her subjects with
the light of God's own grace.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Sing my tongue the virgin's
trophies, who for us her
maker bore; For the curse of
old inflicted, peace and blessings
to restore. Sing his songs of
praise unending, sing the world's
majestic queen; Weary not nor
faint in telling all the gifts
she gives to men.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
All my senses, heart, affections,
strive to sound her glory forth;
spread abroad the sweet
memorials, of the virgin's
priceless worth, where the
voice of music thrilling, where
the tongues of eloquence, the
at can utter hymns beseeming
all her matchless excellence?

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
All our joys, do flow from
Mary, all then join her praise
to sing; Trembling sing the
Virgin Mother, Mother of our
Lord and King. While we sing
her aweful glory, far above
our fancy's reach. Let our
hearts be quick to offer, Love
the heart alone can teach.
